wikipedia_page.main: Zainab Cobbold (born Lady Evelyn Murray; 17 July 1867 – January 1963) was a Scottish diarist, traveller and noblewoman who was known for her conversion to Islam in the Victorian era.

response: Other aristocratic British converts included Sir Archibald Hamilton, 5th Baronet, Rowland Allanson-Winn, 5th Baron Headley, St John Philby and Zainab Cobbold (the first Muslim woman born in Britain to perform the pilgrimage to Mecca).
*Zainab Cobbold – Scottish noblewomanFacey, William (2008). "Mayfair to Makkah" , Saudi Aramco World, Vol. 59, No. 5, pp. 18–23.
* Zainab Cobbold, Anglo-Scot convert to Islam
In 1919, Hambro married Pamela Cobbold, daughter of John Dupuis Cobbold (1861–1929), grandson of John Chevalier Cobbold (1797–1882); and Zainab Cobbold.
His son John Dupuis Cobbold was an artist and the husband of Zainab Cobbold, a Scottish convert to Islam.
